{{Unreferenced|date=June 2018}} {{nihongo|'''Daidarabotchi'''|ダイダラボッチ||}} was a gigantic [[yōkai]] in [[Japanese mythology]], sometimes said to pose as a mountain range when sleeping.
==Mythology== The size of a Daidarabotchi was so great that his footprints were said to have created innumerable lakes and ponds. In one legend, a Daidarabotchi weighed [[Mount Fuji]] and [[Mount Tsukuba]] to see which was heavier. But he accidentally split Tsukuba's peak after he was finished with it.
The ''Hitachi no Kuni [[Fudoki]]'', a recording of the imperial customs in the [[Hitachi Province]] compiled in the 8th century, also told of a Daidarabotchi living on a hill west of a post office of Hiratsu Ogushi who fed on giant clams from the beach, piling the shells on top of a hill.
''Izumo no Kuni Fudoki'' also mentions a legendary king of Izumo, Ōmitsunu, who was the grandson of [[Susanoo]] and a demi-god. Having the strength of a giant, he performed Kuni-biki, pulling land from [[Silla]] with ropes, to increase the size of his territory.
==In popular culture== {{Pop culture|date=June 2018}} * The Great Forest Spirit in the film ''[[Princess Mononoke]]'' appears as the Daidarabotchi after sunset. * Daidarabotchi appears in ''[[Yo-kai Watch]]'' with the English dub name of Dromp. It is the largest Yo-kai in which anyone it inspirits becomes lost in its mazes. In addition, it also appears to have a size-shifting ability where it can appear at either gigantic size to towering over a human.
{{Japanese folklore long}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Daidarabotchi}} [[Category:Japanese folklore]] [[Category:Giants]] [[Category:Yōkai]]
{{japan-myth-stub}}

revision.text:
{{Use mdy dates|date=August 2018}} [[File:Disloyal man with his girlfriend looking at another girl.jpg|thumb|right|The stock photograph which inspired the meme]] The '''distracted boyfriend meme''' is a [[Internet meme|meme]] based on a 2015 [[Stock photography|stock photograph]] by the Spanish photographer Antonio Guillem. Social media users started using the image as a meme at the start of 2017, and it went viral in August 2017 as a way to depict different forms of infidelity. The meme has inspired various spin-offs and received critical acclaim.
==Stock photograph== The stock image was taken in the city of [[Girona]] in [[Catalonia]], [[Spain]], in mid-2015 by the photographer Antonio Guillem from [[Barcelona]].<ref name="Belam 2017">{{cite news |last=Belam |first=Martin |title=I didn't know what a meme was, says Distracted Boyfriend photographer |url=https://www.theguardian.com/media/2017/aug/30/the-team-that-made-the-distracted-boyfriend-meme-have-split-up |accessdate=July 21, 2018 |work=[[The Guardian]] |date=August 30, 2017}}</ref> Guillem told ''[[Wired (magazine)|Wired]]'' he and the stock image models planned on having a session which would represent the concept of infidelity "in a playful and fun way."<ref>{{cite web |last1=Barrett |first1=Brian |title=The 'Distracted Boyfriend' Meme's Photographer Explains All |url=https://www.wired.com/story/distracted-boyfriend-meme-photographer-interview/ |website=[[Wired (magazine)|Wired]] |date=August 28, 2017 |accessdate=July 21, 2018}}</ref> The boyfriend and girlfriend in the photograph are known by their stage names "Mario" and "Laura". "Laura" later described the experience shooting the stock images, saying, "When people saw us simulate those scenes in the street, they stopped to look and laugh and, in my case that I had to have a more serious face, I had a hard time to keeping it".<ref name="Insider interview"/>
The image was uploaded to [[Shutterstock]] with the caption: "Disloyal man walking with his girlfriend and looking amazed at another seductive girl."<ref>{{cite web |last=Molina |first=Brett |url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/tech/talkingtech/2017/08/25/disloyal-man-meme-explained/600822001/ |title=The 'disloyal man' meme, explained |work=[[USA Today]] |date=August 25, 2017 |accessdate=July 21, 2018}}</ref> Regarding the copyright status of this image, Guillem has stated that his images "are subject to copyright laws and the license agreements of the microstock agencies. It's not allowed to use any image without purchasing the proper license in any possible way, so each one of the people that use the images without the license are doing it illegally. This is not the thing that really worries us, as they are just a group of people doing it in good faith, and we are not going to take any action, except for the extreme cases in which this good faith doesn't exist."<ref>{{cite web |last=Zhang |first=Michael |url=https://petapixel.com/2017/09/18/story-behind-viral-distracted-boyfriend-meme-photo/ |title=The Story Behind That Viral 'Distracted Boyfriend' Meme Photo |date=September 18, 2017 |work=PetaPixel |accessdate=July 21, 2018}}</ref>
==Meme==
The first known use of the stock image as an internet meme was posted to a Turkish [[progressive rock]] [[Facebook group]] in January 2017. The post labeled the man as [[Phil Collins]], who is being distracted by pop music away from progressive rock. This meme was reposted on an English-language progressive rock [[Facebook]] page the next day, and then on [[Twitter]] on February 2, 2017.<ref>{{cite web |last=Britton |first=David |url=https://www.dailydot.com/unclick/distracted-boyfriend-memes/ |title=The best Distracted Boyfriend memes |date=July 14, 2018 |accessdate=July 21, 2018}}</ref> Later that month, the original stock photograph was shared on [[Instagram]] and got almost 30,000 likes.<ref name="HuffPost">{{cite news |last=Wanshel |first=Elyse |url=https://www.huffingtonpost.com/entry/distracted-boyfriend-disloyal-man-wandering-eyes-meme_us_59a05626e4b05710aa5bf381 |title=The Story Behind The Stock Photo That Launched A Thousand Jokes |date=August 25, 2017 |work=[[HuffPost]] |accessdate=July 21, 2018}}</ref>
The meme started going viral on August 19, 2017, after a Twitter user posted the photograph with the man labeled "the youth" being distracted from his girlfriend "[[capitalism]]" by "[[socialism]]". Another Twitter user copied this meme, getting retweeted more than 35,000 retweets and nearly 100,000 favorites.<ref name="Vox Romano">{{cite web |last=Romano |first=Aja |url=https://www.vox.com/culture/2017/8/25/16200526/distracted-boyfriend-other-woman-stock-photo-meme |title=Why that "distracted boyfriend" stock photo meme is suddenly everywhere |work=[[Vox (website)|Vox]] |date=August 25, 2017 |accessdate=July 21, 2018}}</ref> The meme and its permutations went viral on Twitter, Reddit, and Facebook.<ref name="Vox Romano"/><ref>{{cite web |last=Hathaway |first=Jay |url=https://www.dailydot.com/unclick/distracted-boyfriend-meme/ |title=The distracted boyfriend is everyone's favorite new meme |date=August 24, 2017 |work=[[The Daily Dot]] |accessdate=July 21, 2018}}</ref> According to Adam Downer, an editor for ''[[Know Your Meme]]'', the distracted boyfriend meme helped popularize a meme format called object labeling.<ref>{{cite web |last=Schwedel |first=Heather |url= https://slate.com/technology/2018/03/memes-are-object-labeled-now.html |title=Thanks to the Distracted Boyfriend, We're Living in a Golden Age of 'Object Labeling' Memes |work=[[Slate (magazine)|Slate]] |date=March 22, 2018 |accessdate=July 21, 2018}}</ref> The girlfriend in the meme generally came to represent something that one is supposed to do, and the woman wearing red came to represent something more desirable or riskier.<ref name="Tansill-Suddath 2018">{{cite news |last=Tansill-Suddath |first=Callie |url=https://www.bustle.com/p/the-distracted-boyfriend-meme-has-18th-century-version-that-people-are-going-wild-for-on-twitter-8816055 |title=The 'Distracted Boyfriend' Meme Has An 18th Century Version That People Are Going Wild For On Twitter |work=[[Bustle (magazine)|Bustle]] |date=April 17, 2018 |accessdate=July 24, 2018}}</ref>
The models "Mario" and "Laura" say they first learned about the memes based on their photograph when people started posting them to their social media accounts.<ref>{{cite web |last=Feldman |first=Brian |url=http://nymag.com/selectall/2017/08/disloyal-man-meme-models-laura-mario-antonio-guillem.html |title='Disloyal Man' Meme Models: 'People Have a Lot of Imagination!' |work=[[New York Magazine]] |date=August 29, 2017 |accessdate=July 21, 2018}}</ref><ref name="Insider interview">{{cite web |url=https://www.thisisinsider.com/distracted-boyfriend-meme-interview-with-couple-2017-8 |title=The spurned girlfriend from the 'distracted boyfriend' meme thinks everyone 'has been the girl in the red dress' |work=INSIDER |publisher=[[Insider Inc.]] |date=August 29, 2017 |accessdate=July 21, 2018}}</ref> Guillem told ''[[The Guardian]]'', "I didn't even know what a meme is until recently. The models discovered the meme on social media and they told me about it. None of us could imagine the media repercussion that it has reached right now."<ref name="Belam 2017"/>
Some brands started using the meme when it started going viral.<ref>{{cite web |last=Bradley |first=Diana |url=https://www.prweek.com/article/1443244/5-brands-insert-themselves-viral-distracted-boyfriend-stock-picture |title=5 brands insert themselves into the viral 'distracted boyfriend' stock picture |work=[[PRWeek]] |date=August 30, 2017 |accessdate=July 21, 2018}}</ref> In early January 2018, a version of the meme referencing the biblical story of [[Lot's wife]] turning into a pillar of salt went viral on Twitter.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Britton |first1=David |title=The 'Distracted Boyfriend' meme gets a biblical makeover |url=https://www.dailydot.com/unclick/distracted-boyfriend-meme-biblical/ |accessdate=July 21, 2018 |work=The Daily Dot |date=January 5, 2018}}</ref> The meme was used in a sign for the "[[Enough! National School Walkout]]" gun violence protest in March 2018.<ref>{{cite news |last=Reinstein |first=Julia |url=https://www.buzzfeed.com/juliareinstein/apush-2050 |title=Teens Brought Their Meme Brilliance To The National School Walkout |work=[[BuzzFeed News]] |date=March 15, 2018 |accessdate=July 21, 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |last=Alemoru |first=Text Kemi |url= http://www.dazeddigital.com/politics/article/39406/1/memes-protest-signs-national-walkout-day-teens-gun-control |title=How memes became an agent of protest in 2018 |date=March 16, 2018 |work=[[Dazed]] |accessdate=July 21, 2018}}</ref> On June 25, 2018, Twitter user Ernie Smith noted other stock images in which the girlfriend from the original meme is surprised looking at screens.<ref>{{cite news |last=Amatulll |first=Jenna |url=https://www.huffingtonpost.com/entry/woman-in-distracted-boyfriend-meme-is-perpetually-shocked-in-other-stock-photos_us_5b325024e4b0b5e692f19424 |title=Woman In Distracted Boyfriend Meme Is Perpetually Shocked In Other Stock Photos |date=June 26, 2018 |work=HuffPost |accessdate=July 21, 2018}}</ref>
==Variations and spin-offs== [[File:The Man between Vice and Virtue.jpg|thumb|Meme inspired by a print of ''[[David Garrick Between Tragedy and Comedy]]'']] Early variations of the distracted meme used other photos from Guillem's photo shoot of the three stock characters to create a story.<ref name="HuffPost"/> In late January 2018, some social media users noted similarities between the meme and promotional image from ''[[Mission: Impossible – Fallout]]'' featuring [[Henry Cavill]] and [[Angela Bassett]].<ref>{{cite web |last=Bastidas |first=Jose |date=January 27, 2018 |url=http://popculture.com/trending/2018/01/28/mission-impossible-6-fallout-teaser-tom-cruise-henry-cavill-distracted-boyfriend-meme/ |title='Mission: Impossible 6' Teaser Resembles 'Distracted Boyfriend' Meme |website=PopCulture.com |publisher=[[Entertainment Tonight]] |accessdate=July 21, 2018}}</ref> On April 16, 2018, a Twitter user called the [[Joshua Reynolds]] painting ''[[David Garrick Between Tragedy and Comedy]]'' the "18th century equivalent" of the distracted boyfriend meme,<ref>{{cite web |last=Kelly |first=Tiffany |url=https://www.dailydot.com/unclick/18th-century-distracted-boyfriend-meme/ |title=This 18th-century painting looks like the Distracted Boyfriend meme |work=The Daily Dot |date=April 17, 2018 |accessdate=July 21, 2018}}</ref> and the painting became popular as a similar meme with historic references.<ref name="Tansill-Suddath 2018"/>
In early May 2018, a Twitter user posted the coin commemorating the [[wedding of Prince Harry and Meghan Markle]] with one of the characters from the meme.<ref>{{cite web |last=Reitz |first=Collette |url=https://www.elitedaily.com/p/this-meme-with-meghan-markle-prince-harrys-coin-will-be-your-new-favorite-8979700 |title=Meghan Markle & Prince Harry's Coin Just Got Turned Into The Funniest Meme |work=[[Elite Daily]] |date=May 4, 2018 |accessdate=July 21, 2018}}</ref> In early June 2018, film writer Peter Goldberg posted on his Twitter account a scene from [[Charlie Chaplin]]'s 1922 short film ''[[Pay Day (1922 film)|Pay Day]]'' with a format similar to the distracted boyfriend meme.<ref>{{cite news |last=Novak |first=Matt |url=https://paleofuture.gizmodo.com/did-charlie-chaplin-invent-the-distracted-boyfriend-mem-1826726244 |title=Did Charlie Chaplin Invent the Distracted Boyfriend Meme? |work=[[Gizmodo|Paleofuture]] |publisher=[[Gizmodo Media Group]] |date=June 11, 2018 |accessdate=July 21, 2018}}</ref> In early July 2018, a photograph of a woman eating ice cream with a man and a woman holding hands in Venice went viral because of its similarities to the distracted boyfriend meme.<ref>{{cite news |last=Drascott |first=Edd |url=https://www.independent.ie/world-news/and-finally/this-photobomber-recreated-the-distracted-boyfriend-meme-by-fluke-37093705.html |title=This photobomber recreated the Distracted Boyfriend meme by fluke |work=[[Irish Independent]] |publisher=Press Association |date=July 8, 2018 |accessdate=July 21, 2018}}</ref> A version of the meme featuring a distracted groom went viral on Twitter in early October 2018.<ref>{{cite web |last=Bruner |first=Raisa |url=http://time.com/5412058/distracted-groom-meme/ |title=Distracted Groom Meme Is a Step Up From Distracted Boyfriend |work=Time |date=October 1, 2018 |accessdate=October 2, 2018}}</ref>
==Reception==
Nathan Heller of ''[[The New Yorker]]'' wrote that "the delight of the Distracted Boyfriend meme was not unlike the perverse pleasure taken by Distracted Boyfriend himself: it allowed America to turn its attention away from much more important commitments."<ref>{{cite web |last=Heller |first=Nathan |url=https://www.newyorker.com/culture/likes/the-distracted-boyfriend-memes-perverse-pleasure-in-2017 |title=The Distracted Boyfriend Meme's Perverse Pleasure in 2017 |work=[[The New Yorker]] |date=December 11, 2017 |accessdate=July 21, 2018}}</ref> Tiffany Kelly of ''[[The Daily Dot]]'' wrote that "the distracted boyfriend meme's range, unintentionally created by Guillem's portfolio, set it apart from other popular internet content [in 2017]."<ref>{{cite web |last=Kelly |first=Tiffany |title=Distracted Boyfriend Is the Meme of the Year |url=https://www.dailydot.com/unclick/distracted-boyfriend-meme-2017/ |work=The Daily Dot |date=December 25, 2017 |accessdate=July 21, 2018}}</ref> Clair Valentine listed the meme as one that defined the year 2017, writing, "They say that often, the most specific stories are in fact the most universal, and this meme's absurd popularity proves that point beyond a shadow of a doubt."<ref>{{cite web |last=Valentine |first=Claire |url=http://www.papermag.com/10-memes-that-defined-20171-2519639924.html |title=The 10 Memes That Defined 2017 |date=December 30, 2017 |work=[[Paper (magazine)|Paper]] |accessdate=July 21, 2018}}</ref>
The meme made various lists of the top memes of 2017, including [[NDTV]]<ref>{{cite news |url=https://gadgets.ndtv.com/internet/features/from-salt-bae-to-distracted-boyfriend-10-memes-we-loved-in-2017-1792048 |title=From Salt Bae to Distracted Boyfriend, 10 Memes We Loved in 2017 |work=Gadgets360 |publisher=[[NDTV]] |date=December 25, 2017 |accessdate=July 21, 2018}}</ref> ''The Next Web'',<ref>{{cite news |last=Kaser |first=Rachel |url=https://thenextweb.com/creative/2017/12/25/2017-memes-best-best/ |title=2017 in Memes: The best of the best |date=December 25, 2017 |work=The Next Web |accessdate=July 21, 2018}}</ref> ''[[PC Magazine]]'',<ref>{{cite web |last=Moscaritolo |first=Angela |url=https://www.pcmag.com/feature/358023/distracted-boyfriend-to-salt-bae-2017-s-best-memes |title=Distracted Boyfriend to Salt Bae: 2017's Best Memes |work=[[PC Magazine]] |date=December 20, 2017 |accessdate=July 21, 2018}}</ref> ''[[The Ringer (website)|The Ringer]]'',<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.theringer.com/tech/2017/12/21/16802254/best-memes-2017 |title=The Best Memes of 2017 |work=[[The Ringer (website)|The Ringer]] |date=December 21, 2018 |accessdate=July 21, 2018}}</ref> and ''[[Narcity]]''.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.narcity.com/entertainment/here-are-the-top-memes-of-2017 |title=Here Are The Top Memes Of 2017 |work=Narcity |publisher=[[Narcity Media]] |date=December 19, 2017 |accessdate=July 21, 2018}}</ref> The meme was listed on ''[[The Washington Post]]''{{'}}s "Meme Hall of Fame of 2017", calling it "the ultimate stock photo meme with endless permutations."<ref>{{cite news |last=Podnar |first=Rachel |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/express/wp/2017/12/28/trending-meme-hall-of-fame-of-2107/ |title=Trending: Meme Hall of Fame of 2017 |work=[[The Washington Post]] |date=December 28, 2017 |accessdate=July 21, 2018}}</ref> The [[Reddit]] moderators of the /r/MemeEconomy subreddit called the distracted boyfriend meme one of the best memes of 2017.<ref>{{cite web |last=Paoletta |first=Rae |url=https://www.inverse.com/article/39732-reddit-moderators-best-and-worst-memes-2017 |title=Reddit Moderators Reveal The Best Memes of 2017, And The Ones That Must Die |work=[[Inverse (website)|Inverse]] |date=December 26, 2017 |accessdate=July 21, 2018}}</ref> In April 2018, the distracted boyfriend meme won the Best Meme of 2017 category at the 10th Annual [[Shorty Awards]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://cheezburger.com/5351173/its-official-the-shorty-awards-have-declared-distracted-boyfriend-the-best-meme-of-2017 |title=It's Official: The Shorty Awards Have Declared 'Distracted Boyfriend' The Best Meme Of 2017 |work=Memebase |publisher=[[Cheezburger]] |date=April 16, 2018 |accessdate=July 21, 2018}}</ref>
Joe McCarthy of ''[[Global Citizen (website)|Global Citizen]]'' wrote the original photograph depicts sexual harassment, and criticized most uses of the meme for failing "to transcend the image's inherent, toxic sexism."<ref>{{cite web |last=McCarthy |first=Joe |url=https://www.globalcitizen.org/en/content/disloyal-man-meme/ |title=The Best 'Disloyal Man' Meme Shows Why It's Problematic |work=Global Citizen |publisher=[[Global Poverty Project]] |date=August 24, 2017 |accessdate=July 21, 2018}}</ref> In September 2018, [[Sweden]]'s advertising ombudsman determined the internet service provider [[Bahnhof]] had broken rules against gender discrimination with its advertisement using the meme, which portrayed Bahnhof's employment opportunities as the attention-stealing woman and the ignored girlfriend as "your current workplace".<ref name=NYTimes20180926>{{cite news |last1=Tsang |first1=Amie |title=The Distracted Boyfriend Who Took Over the Internet Is Deemed Sexist in Sweden |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2018/09/26/business/sweden-distracted-boyfriend-meme-sexist.html |work=The New York Times |date=September 26, 2018 |accessdate=September 27, 2018}}</ref>
==References== {{reflist}}
==External links== *[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/distracted-boyfriend Distracted Boyfriend] entry in [[Know Your Meme]] *"[https://www.shutterstock.com/image-photo/disloyal-man-walking-his-girlfriend-looking-297886754 Disloyal man walking with his girlfriend and looking amazed at another seductive girl"] on [[Shutterstock]] *"[https://www.istockphoto.com/photo/disloyal-man-with-his-girlfriend-looking-at-another-girl-gm493656728-77018851 Disloyal man with his girlfriend looking at another girl]" on [[iStock]] *[http://antonioguillem.com AntonioGuillem.com], website of the stock photographer

Undid revision 865442870 by [[Special:Contributions/181.43.19.249|181.43.19.249]] ([[User talk:181.43.19.249|talk]]) This article about a Spanish word lists the Spanish pronunciation used in Spain. Please get [[WP:CONS|consensus]] on the Talk page to use a derived pronunciation from Latin America.
revision.text:
{{original research |discuss=Embarazada#Original research |date=February 2018}}
{{wiktionary|embarazada}} '''''Embarazada''''' ({{IPA-es|embaɾaˈθaða}}) is the [[Spanish language|Spanish]] word for [[pregnancy|pregnant]]. It is a [[false friend]] for native [[English language|English]]-speaking [[Spanish as a second language|students of Spanish]] who may attempt to say "I'm [[Embarrassment|embarrassed]]" by saying "''estoy embarazada''". This phrase actually means "I'm pregnant" in Spanish. This may be confusing to Spanish speakers who are not familiar with the English word.
==Spanish usage== The correct way to say "I'm embarrassed" in Spanish is using the phrase ''tengo [[wikt:vergüenza|vergüenza]]'' (meaning "I have shame") or the more formal phrases ''me da vergüenza'' or ''estoy [[wikt:avergonzado|avergonzado]]/a''.<ref>"embarazada", Collins Spanish Dictionary (2003) p. 1311.</ref> Yet, in Spanish, there also exists the adjective ''[[wikt:|embarazoso]],'' meaning the same as "embarrassing" in its denotation of something that causes a sensation of unease, but not of shame.<ref>"embarazoso", Collins Spanish Dictionary (2003), p. 380.</ref> Complicating the issue further, ''embarazada'' can sometimes also mean "hampered", or "hindered".<ref>"embarazar", Collins Spanish Dictionary (2003)</ref> This more closely mirrors the original meaning of the English word ''embarrass''.<ref name="OED">"embarrass", The Oxford English Dictionary, (1989) <http://dictionary.oed.com> [Retrieved on 2006-02-15].</ref>
===Grammar=== ''Embarazada'' is a [[past participle]], meaning that it indicates a state resulting from a previous action. In English, past participles usually end in ''-ed'' (e.g., ''destroy'''ed'''''), and ''embarazado'' therefore translates directly into English as "impregnated". It is a conjugated form of ''embarazar'' "to impregnate". As the word ''embarazado'' is masculine, it is rarely encountered in Spanish. It is more common for the word ''embarazad'''a''''' to be used to describe pregnancy. However, ''embarazado'' can be used as a past participle in perfect tenses, as in: "El hombre ha embarazado a la mujer." (The man has impregnated the woman.)
==Etymology== The English word ''embarrassed'' is indirectly derived from the Spanish word. The first recorded usage of ''embarrass'' in English was in 1664 by [[Samuel Pepys]] in his diary. The word was derived from the French word ''embarrasser'', "to block" or "to obstruct", or figuratively, "to put one in a difficult situation".<ref name="OED"/> The first recorded usage was by [[Michel de Montaigne]] in 1580. The French word was derived from the Spanish ''embarazar'', whose first recorded usage was in 1460 in ''Cancionero de Stúñiga'' (Songbook of Stúñiga) by [[Álvaro de Luna]].<ref name="Corominas">Joan Corominas and José Pacual, "embarazar", Diccionario crítico etimológico castellano e hispánico, (Gredos, 1980) Vol. II, p. 555-556.</ref>
The Spanish word likely comes from the [[Portuguese language|Portuguese]] ''embaraçar'' (used in the same context of English ''embarrassment''), which probably is a combination of the [[Prefix (linguistics)|prefix]] ''em-'' (from Latin ''in-'' for "in-") with ''baraça'' "a noose", or "rope", which makes sense with the synonym ''encinta'' ("on noose, on rope" because of the old usage of women to wear a strap of cloth on their dresses when pregnant).<ref>"embarrass", Webster's Third New International Dictionary, Unabridged, (2002) <http://unabridged.merriam-webster.com> [Retrieved on 2006-02-15].</ref> ''Baraça'' originated before the Romans began their conquest of the [[Iberian Peninsula]] in 218 BCE.<ref name="Corominas"/> Thus, ''baraça'' could be related to the [[Celtic languages|Celtic]] word ''barr'', "tuft". (Celtic people actually settled much of Spain and Portugal beginning in the 700s BCE, the second group of Indo-European language speakers to do so.)<ref>"Iberian", Encyclopædia Britannica, <http://www.britannica.com/eb/article-9041884> [Retrieved on 2006-02-15].</ref> However, it certainly is not directly derived from it, as the substitution of ''r'' for ''rr'' in [[Iberian Romance languages]] was not a known occurrence.
Some say the Spanish word actually came from the Italian ''imbarazzare'', from ''imbarazzo'', "obstacle" or "obstruction". That word came from ''imbarrare'', "to block" or "to bar", which is a combination of ''in-'', "in", with ''barra'', "bar" (from the [[Vulgar Latin]] ''barra'', which is of unknown origin).<ref name="Corominas"/> The problem with this theory is that the first known usage of the word in Italian was by [[Bernardo Davanzati]] (1529-1606), long after the word had entered Spanish.<ref>"embarrass", The American Heritage Dictionary of the English Language, (2000) <{{cite web |url=http://www.bartleby.com/61/12/E0101200.html |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2006-02-15 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20060211111021/http://www.bartleby.com/61/12/E0101200.html |archivedate=2006-02-11 |df= }}> [Retrieved on 2006-02-15].</ref> Thus, modern scholars believe that the Italian word actually came from the Spanish one.<ref>"imbarazzare", Grande Dizionario Italiano, (2007) <http://www.garzantilinguistica.it/interna_ita.html> [Retrieved on 2006-10-29].</ref>
==Commercial implications== When [[The Parker Pen Company|Parker Pen]] entered the [[Mexico|Mexican]] market, its [[advertisement]]s which claimed that Parker Pens "won't leak in your pocket and embarrass you" was [[translation|mistranslated]] to "''No te embarazará chorreándose en tu bolsillo''", which means "Won't leak in your pocket and impregnate you".<ref>Sandy Serva, iLanguage Translations for Global Research, January 2003, Vol. 26, Issue 1, p 51.</ref>
==In popular culture== *The comic ''Married To The Sea'' refers to the mistranslation in the February 28, 2009 comic. The text reads, with English in parentheses, "Hey, look back up at number 3... you want to use "avergonzada" (embarrassed) there. You put "yo estoy embarazada." (I am pregnant.) You better not be embarazada, Julie, because yo no quiero ser a fuckin' abuela (I don't want to be a fuckin' grandma) at thirty-nine."<ref>Married To The Sea, 02/28/2009, <http://www.marriedtothesea.com/022809/spanish-homework.gif></ref> *On the ABC sitcom ''[[Modern Family]]'', Gloria is upset that her son Manny is forgetting his Spanish. Manny tells his mother: "Yo soy embarazada." This not only refers to the mistranslation, but also has Manny using the incorrect word for "to be", ''ser'', which is used for characteristics of a person or object, rather than conditions, such as one's being pregnant. Gloria points out his mistake. *In the animated series ''[[King of the Hill]]'', the character Peggy Hill tells a judge at a courtroom in Mexico that she is "muy embarazada".<ref>https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7cmWlZXSH44</ref>
==See also== {{Portal|Spain}} *[[Spanglish]]
==References== {{reflist|30em}}
[[Category:Spanish language]] [[Category:False friends]]

revision.comment: /* Career */Updated for accuracy.
revision.text:
'''Emily Rice''' is an astronomy professor at the [[City University of New York]]. In addition to her scientific contributions to the study of the atmospheric properties of low mass astronomical bodies, she has become well known for her astronomy-related public outreach projects. She is the co-founder of an astro-centric fashion blog titled the STARtorialist, a host for the public outreach series Astronomy on Tap, a parody video creator, and a current research associate for the [[American Museum of Natural History]] in New York City.<ref name=hanson2016>Hanson, Alex. [https://herpothesis.com/2016/01/20/interview-emily-rice/#more-169 "Astrophysics, Fashion, and DJ Carly Sagan: An Interview with Emily Rice"], ''[[HERpothesis]]'', 20 January 2016. Retrieved on 5 November 2016.</ref> She has also served as a public presenter at the Hayden Planetarium in New York.<ref name=hanson2016 /><ref name=ricesite>{{cite web | url = http://www.amnh.org/our-research/staff-directory/emily-l.-rice/ | publisher = [[American Museum of Natural History]] | title = Staff Directory - Emily Rice}}</ref>
== Education == Rice attended the University of Pittsburgh where she was awarded two B.A. degrees, one in Physics & Astronomy, and the other in German. Following her graduation from the University of Pittsburgh, she then moved to Los Angeles where she completed her M.S. and her Ph.D. at the University of California, Los Angeles.<ref name=cuny>{{cite web | url = http://www.csi.cuny.edu/faculty/RICE_EMILY.html | publisher = City University of New York | title = Faculty Directory - Emily Rice}}</ref> Her master's thesis centered around the characterization of stars within the a young star cluster in the constellation of [[Aquila (constellation)|Aquila]].<ref name="uclaresearch">{{cite web|url=http://www.astro.ucla.edu/~erice/research.html|title=Emily L. Rice - UCLA Astronomy|last=Rice|first=Emily|date=|website=www.astro.ucla.edu|publisher=|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=5 November 2016}}</ref> The results of her thesis, which relied upon high-resolution spectra obtained by [[Lisa Prato]], were published in the Astrophysical Journal in 2006 and in the upcoming Handbook of Star Forming Regions.<ref name=uclaresearch /> For her Ph.D., Rice investigated the physical properties of brown dwarf atmospheres and current model deficiencies via near-infrared spectra.<ref name=uclaresearch/> Once her Ph.D. was completed, she served as a postdoctoral fellow for [[Rebecca Oppenheimer]] at the American Museum of Natural History in the Exoplanet Group.<ref name=ricesite/><ref name=uclaresearch/>
== Career == Rice is a current faculty member in the Department of Physics & Astronomy at the College of Staten Island, which is part of the City University of New York.<ref name=stat>{{cite web | url = http://www.csi.cuny.edu/faculty/RICE_EMILY.html | publisher = City University of New York |title= Faculty Alpha List - Emily Rice}}</ref> In addition to her role as an Associate Professor, she is also a founding member of the Brown Dwarfs in New York City (BDNYC) research group.<ref name=stat/> Her work primarily focuses on near-infrared spectra to characterize the properties of the lowest mass objects in our galaxy, namely: [[brown dwarfs]], very low-mass stars, and giant [[exoplanets]], as well as investigating stellar and planetary system formation mechanisms.<ref name=ricesite/><ref name=stat/> Her work has resulted in over 30 co-authored publications.<ref name="startalk">{{cite web|url=https://www.startalkradio.net/bio/emily-rice/|title=About Emily Rice|last=|first=|date=|website=|publisher=Star Talk|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref> Rice also co-designed and authored a collection of introductory astronomy labs for use in entry-level astronomy courses entitled Astronomy Labs: A Concept Oriented Approach.<ref name=startalk/>
She is also well known for her continued involvement with the American Museum of Natural History as a research associate and occasional planetarium presenter at the Hayden Planetarium.<ref name=ricesite/>
In 2015, she was awarded the Henry Wasser Award for Outstanding Scholarship from CUNY Academy for the Humanities and Sciences.<ref name=startalk/>
== Public outreach == Though she has made tremendous contributions to her field of research, Rice stands out for her successful public outreach activities. She is the co-founder, with [[Summer Ash]] of an astronomy-centered fashion blog called the STARtorialist, which boasts the tagline: "Where science meets fashion and scientists get fabulous".<ref name=ricesite/><ref name=stat/><ref name=startalk/><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://startorialist.com/|title=STARtorialist|last=Rice|first=Emily|last2=Ash|first2=Summer|date=|website=startorialist.com|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref>
She also dons the moniker DJ Carly Sagan, in honor of the legendary science popularizer [[Carl Sagan]], to organize and host engaging, free-to-the-public science gatherings and presentations at bars in New York City as part of the Astronomy on Tap series.<ref name=ricesite/><ref name=stat/><ref name=startalk/><ref name="astrotap">{{cite web|url=http://astronomyontap.org/|title=Astronomy On Tap|last=|first=|date=|website=astronomyontap.org|publisher=|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref>
==References== {{reflist}}
{{Authority control}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Rice, Emily}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:City University of New York]] [[Category:American Museum of Natural History]] [[Category:American astronomers]] [[Category:Women astronomers]]

In '''''Ex parte Alberts''''', an important case in [[South African insolvency law]], the applicant’s schedules showed assets to the value of £76 and fifteen creditors (all concurrent) for £300. The court held that, before a court may accept a voluntary surrender,
* it must be satisfied that it will be to the advantage of creditors of the debtor if his estate is sequestrated; * the petition must contain a specific allegation that the sequestration will be to the advantage of the creditors; and * the allegation must be amplified by facts supporting it, save when the figures speak for themselves.
The court held that an insufficient case had been made out to show that the sequestration would be to the advantage to the creditors and that the application should be refused.
== See also == * [[South African insolvency law]]
== References == * ''Ex parte Alberts'' 1944 TPD 185.
== Notes == {{Reflist}}
[[Category:1945 in South African law]] [[Category:1945 in case law]] [[Category:South African insolvency case law]]
{{SouthAfrica-case-law-stub}}

revision.comment: "brant" to "brand"
revision.text:
{{More citations needed|date=February 2017}}
A '''fire-resistance rating''' typically means the duration for which a [[passive fire protection]] [[system]] can withstand a standard [[fire test|fire resistance test]]. This can be quantified simply as a measure of time, or it may entail a host of other criteria, involving other evidence of functionality or fitness for purpose.
==Common rating systems== The following depict the most commonly used international time/temperature curves: <gallery> File:Din iso astm ul curves.JPG|[[Time]]/[[Temperature]] Curves used for testing the fire-resistance rating of [[passive fire protection]] [[system]]s such as [[firestop]]s, [[fire door]]s, wall and floor assemblies, etc., which are used in [[Compartmentalization (fire protection)|compartmentalisation]] in [[building]]s and the [[petrochemical industry]] in [[Europe]] and [[North America]]. File:Tunnel hc iso curves.jpg|Time/Temperature Curves used for testing the fire-resistance rating of passive fire protection systems in tunnels in [[Germany]], The [[Netherlands]] and [[France]]. File:Rws tunnel curve.jpg|Time/Temperature Curve used for testing the fire-resistance rating of passive fire protection systems in tunnels in The Netherlands. File:Eurocode 1 curve.jpg|Time/Temperature Curve used for testing the fire-resistance rating of passive fire protection systems in [[Europe]]. File:French hc curve 1.jpg|Time/Temperature Curve used for testing the fire-resistance rating of passive fire protection systems in tunnels in [[France]]. File:German tunnel curves.jpg|Time/Temperature Curve used for testing the fire-resistance rating of passive fire protection systems in tunnels in [[Germany]]. File:Euro furnace pressure.jpg|Furnace [[pressure]] is also subject to standardised tolerances for testing to obtain fire-resistance ratings. This image shows European tolerances, subject to NEN-[[EN 1363-1]]. File:temp tolerance.jpg|Furnace Temperatures for fire testing to obtain fire-resistance ratings are subject to certain tolerances. This graph shows the tolerance applicable to the European building elements / cellulosic curve. File:Moac_time_temperature_curve_astm_3134.png|MOAC: Mother of all curves “Reprinted, with permission, from E3134-17 Standard Specification for Transportation Tunnel Structural Components and Passive Fire Protection Systems, copyright ASTM International, 100 Barr Harbor Drive, West Conshohocken, PA 19428. A copy of the complete standard may be obtained from ASTM International, http://www.astm.org." </gallery>
==International fire-resistance ratings== There are many international variations for nearly countless types of products and systems, some with multiple test requirements.
[[Canada]]'s Institute for Research in Construction (a part of the National Research Council and publisher of Canada's model building code - NBC) requires a special test regime for firestops for [[plastic]] [[pipe (material)|pipe]] [[penetrant (mechanical, electrical, or structural)|penetrants]]. Fire endurance tests for this application must be run under 50Pa positive furnace pressure in order to adequately simulate the effect of potential temperature differences between indoor and outdoor temperatures in Canada's winters. Special hoods are applied here to provide suction on the top side of a test assembly in order to reach the 50Pa pressure differential. Afterwards, a 30PSI hose-stream test may be applied.
Outdoor spray [[fireproofing]] methods that must be qualified to the [[hydrocarbon]] curve may be required to pass a host of environmental tests before any burn takes place, to minimize the likelihood that ordinary operational environments cannot render a vital system component useless before it ever encounters a [[fire]].
If critical environmental conditions are not satisfied, an assembly may not be eligible for a fire-resistance rating.
Regardless of the complexity of any given test regime that may lead to a rating, the premise is generally [[product certification]] and, most importantly [[listing and approval use and compliance]]. Testing without certification and installations that cannot be matched with an appropriate [[certification listing]], are not usually recognised by any [[Authority Having Jurisdiction]] (AHJ) unless it is in a realm where [[product certification]] is optional.
==Tests for fire resistance of record protection equipment== The following classifications may be attained when testing in accordance with UL 72.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://ulstandards.ul.com/standard/?id=72|title=Standard 72 - Standard for Tests for Fire Resistance of Record Protect|website=ulstandards.ul.com|accessdate=2016-09-21}}</ref>
===Class 125 Rating=== This rating is the requirement in data safes and vault structures for protecting digital information on magnetic media or hard drives. Temperatures inside the protected chamber must be held below {{convert|125|F|C}} for the time period specified, such as Class 125-2 Hour, with temperatures up to {{convert|2000|F|C}} outside the vault. The temperature reading is taken on the inside surfaces of the protective structure. Maintaining the temperature below 125 °F. is critical because data is lost above that temperature threshold, even if the media or hard drives appear to be intact.
===Class 150 Rating=== This is the rating required to protect microfilm, microfiche, and other film-based information storage media. Above 150 °F (65.5 °C) film is distorted by the heat and information is lost. A Class 150-2 Hour vault must keep the temperature below 150 °F. for at least two hours, with temperatures up to 2,000 °F. (1,093.3 °C) outside the vault.
===Class 350 Rating=== This rating is the requirement for protecting paper documents. Above 350 °F (176.7 °C) paper is distorted by the heat and information is lost. A Class 350-4 Hour vault must keep the temperature below 350 °F. for at least four hours, with temperatures up to 2,000 °F. (1,093.3 °C) outside the vault.
==Different time/temperature curves== Typically, most countries use the '''building elements curve'''for residential and commercial spaces, which is nearly identical in most countries as that is what results by burning [[wood]]. The building elements curve is characterized jointly by, including, but not limited to, DIN4102, BS476, ASTM E119, ULC-S101, etc. For industrial facilities in the hydrocarbon & petrochemical industries, a hydrocarbon curve (such as UL 1709) is used, reflecting a more rapid temperature rise. The only commonly used exposure beyond this, apart from the more recent tunnel curves shown above, would be the jet fire exposure standards such as ISO 22899, which are used where equipment may be subject to the extreme heat and momentum effects of jet fire exposure.
Big differences between different countries in terms of the use of the curves include the use of pipes, which shield the furnace thermocouples inside of NAFTA testing laboratories. This slows down the response time and results in a somewhat more conservative test regime in [[North America]]. On the other hand, the [[International Organization for Standardization|ISO]] based [[Europe]]an curves run somewhat hotter for most of the test. North America also selectively uses a hose-stream test between 30 and 45PSI, to simulate real-world impacts and damages that may not be simulated in a laboratory. The US Navy even insists on a 90PSI hose-stream test for some of its assemblies, which may simulate the pressure available to firefighters in fighting a fire, but which has little to do with countermeasures against damaging effects of manual fire suppression. The hose-stream is simply intended to add a level of toughness to matters because without this, some fairly flimsy systems can pass a test, thus receive a rating and thus be permissible by a [[building code]] but be so weak that ordinary building use may damage a thus qualified system before it encounters a fire.
Germany's DIN4102 also includes a significant impact test for a potential [[firewall (construction)|firewall]], which is, however, applied from the wrong side: the cold side. Applying the impact from the cold side is more practical to do in a lab setting, however, potential impacts should come from the exposed side, not the unexposed side. Still, for the person designing, building and paying for the test, the fire resistance itself may be rather uneventful unless major problems appear. The burn itself is the long duration, up to 4 hours, but the hose stream test only lasts a few minutes, with large damage potential due to the sudden thermal and kinetic impacts, as the fire was upwards of 1,100 °C (see curves above), whereas the sudden hose-stream test is as cold as the domestic water fed to the fire hose used in the test, which might be 10-20 °C. This combined impact explains the debris that can be seen coming from test specimens during the hose stream test, as seen herein.
Because of the large differences in test regimes all over the world, even for ''identical products and systems'', organizations that intend to market their products internationally are often required to run many tests in many countries. Even where test regimes are identical, countries are often reluctant to accept the test results and particularly the certification methods of other countries.
During a fire in a [[tunnel]], as well as in the petrochemical industry, temperatures exceed those of ordinary building (cellulosic) fires. This is because the fuel for the fire is [[hydrocarbon]]s, which burn hotter (compare hydrocarbon curve above to ASTM E119 curve), faster and typically run out of fuel faster as well, compared against timber. The added complication with tunnels is that the environment inside a "tube" is best described as a "microclimate". The heat cannot escape as well as it can in a burning refinery, which is in the open. Instead, the fire is confined to a narrow tube, where pressure and heat build up and spread rapidly, with little room for escape and little chance of [[compartmentalization (fire protection)|compartmentalization]]. This scenario was tested and quantified, particularly during the "Eureka Project", run by [[Technische Universität Braunschweig]]'s iBMB, Ekkehard Richter. The Netherlands, through [[Rijkswaterstaat]] in particular, mandated an extremely tough standard, the curve of which is shown in the gallery above.
==Example of a fire stop fire-resistance rating test== Construction of a test sample consists of a mockup of a section of [[concrete]] floor, with typical mechanical and electrical utility components (pipes and cables) [[penetrant (mechanical, electrical, or structural)|penetrating]] the floor assembly. A [[mortar (firestop)|firestop mortar]] is applied around the penetrations.
The completed test sample is inserted into a furnace such that one side is exposed to a fire. The test is terminated when the fire stops successfully meet the test criteria in minimizing the amount of heat and smoke allowed to pass through the assembly, when the fire penetrates the fire stops. This determines the fire stop '''F-Rating'''. The length of time required for a penetrant or sample on average to exceed a specified average heat rise above ambient at any single location determines the duration for the '''FT Rating''' (Fire and Temperature). If a hose-stream test is passed afterwards, the rating can then be expressed as an '''FTH Rating''' (Fire, Temperature and Hose-stream). The lowest of the three determines the overall rating. [[File:ulc nachher alles dicht.jpg|thumb|none]]
'''''Part B:''''' The Burning Branding Test. This test consists of mock decks being subject the placement of a burning brand in the center of the mock deck to simulate the falling of burning embers during a wildfire. The deck must be absent of flame after the 40 minute test period and lack structural failure of any boards. [[File:Buring-brand-fire-Test.jpg|thumb|left|TimberSIL wood Burning Brand Test 0:00:00]] [[File:Buring-brand-fire-Test-0-40-09.jpg|thumb|none|TimberSIL wood Burning Brand Test after 0:40:09]] {{clear left}}
==See also== {{div col|colwidth=22em}} * [[Building code]] * [[Certification listing]] * [[Construction]] * [[Deutsches Institut für Bautechnik]] * [[EN 16034]] * [[Endothermic]] * [[Fire protection]] * [[Fireproofing]] * [[Firestop]] * [[Firestop pillow]] * [[Firewall (construction)]] * [[Intumescent]] * [[Mortar (firestop)]] * [[Passive fire protection]] {{div col end}}

revision.text:
<!-- Article title: Glenalvon House SHRNo:4 DatabaseNo:5045750 --> {{Use Australian English|date=June 2018}} {{Use dmy dates|date=June 2018}} {{Infobox historic site | name = Glenalvon House | image = (1)Glenalvin Lithgow Street Campbell.jpg | caption = ''Glenalvon'', in 2009 | locmapin = Australia Sydney | map_caption = | coordinates = {{coord|-34.0675|150.8149|region:AU-NSW_type:landmark|display=inline,title|format=dms}} | map_relief = yes | location = 8 Lithgow Street, [[Campbelltown, New South Wales|Campbelltown]], [[City of Campbelltown (New South Wales)|City of Campbelltown]], [[New South Wales]], Australia | area = | elevation = | height = | beginning_label = Design period | beginning_date = | formed = | founded = | built = 1841 | built_for = Michael Byrne | demolished = | architect = | architecture = [[Australian residential architectural styles#Georgian|Georgian (Victorian)]] | website = {{URL|http://www.cahs.com.au/glenalvon.html}} | owner = Department of Planning and Infrastructure | designation1 = New South Wales State Heritage Register | designation1_offname = Glenalvon; Glenalvon and Stables | designation1_type = State heritage (built) | designation1_criteria = [[New South Wales State Heritage Register#Criteria|a., c., d., e., f., g.]] | designation1_date = 2 April 1999 | delisted1_date = | designation1_partof = | designation1_number = 4 | designation1_free1name = Type | designation1_free1value = House | designation1_free2name = Category | designation1_free2value = Residential buildings (private) | designation1_free3name = Builders | designation1_free3value = Michael Byrne }}
'''Glenalvon House''' is a heritage-listed [[homestead (buildings)|homestead]] located at 8 Lithgow Street, [[Campbelltown, New South Wales|Campbelltown]] in the [[City of Campbelltown (New South Wales)|City of Campbelltown]] local government area of [[New South Wales]], Australia. It was designed and built in 1841 by Michael Byrne. It is also known as '''''Glenalvon''''' and '''''Glenalvon'' and Stables'''. The property is owned by Department of Planning and Infrastructure, an [[government agency|agency]] of the [[Government of New South Wales]]. It was added to the [[New South Wales State Heritage Register]] on 2 April 1999.<ref name=nswshr-4>{{cite NSW SHR|5045750|Glenalvon|hr=00004|fn=EF14/4525; S90/6168; H99/55|accessdate=1 June 2018}}</ref><ref name=AHD>{{cite AHD|3257|Glenalvon and Stables, Lithgow St, Campbelltown|date=21 March 1978|accessdate=6 October 2017}}</ref>
Glenalvon House and farm was the family home of Michael Byrne, a publican. The homestead in the [[Australian residential architectural styles#Georgian|Victorian Georgian]] style was built in 1840. The homestead is managed by Campbelltown and Airds Historical Society Inc. as a [[museum]] that is open to the public for a modest fee.
== History == The outline of the house is first shown on two town plans dated November 1840, although the stables are not shown at this time. It is thought that Michael Byrne, a publican, built the house around this time on the [[land grant|grant]] of 1 acre and 32 perches which was taken up in 1831. Although it is possible that the outbuildings were not shown, it is more likely that the stables were constructed later (which would be supported by the differing styles of the two buildings).<ref name=nswshr-4/>
Michael Byrne was born in County Wicklow, near Dublin in 1800, the son of Hugh and Sarah Byrne. [[Hugh Byrne (rugby league)|Hugh Byrne]] was convicted without trial and transported to Australia, with his family, in 1802 for treasonous practices in the 1798 Irish Rebellion. Michael Byrne was made an apprentice to Lawrence Butler, Irish overseer of the [[Government of New South Wales|NSW Government]] Lumber Yards, [[Sydney]]. Michael Byrne went on to own seven pubs in Campbelltown. He was trialled, though not found guilty, of kicking a man to death for non-payment of a debt. Byrne himself was made insolvent in 1844, after having built in 1841, ''Glenalvon'', the finest stone house in the town.<ref>Lucas & McGinnes, 2012.</ref> He died in 1878 and is buried in the Irish corner of the Roman Catholic Cemetery in Campbelltown.<ref name=nswshr-4-42>Oakman, W., in Broadbent, Clarke & Oakman, 2008</ref><ref name=nswshr-4/>
By the 1840s various members of the Byrne family were experiencing financial difficulties, including Michael who by 1844 owed his brother-in-law, John Keighran (publican) the sum of [[Australian pound|A₤]]880 17[[Australian shilling|s]] 3[[Australian penny|d]]. As partial payment of the debt John accepted the property in Lithgow Street and a {{convert|36|acre|ha|0|adj=on|order=flip}} farm also owned by Byrne. Keighran is believed to have taken up residence in Glenalvon, along with his wife Catherine Byrne, sometime in 1853. They would eventually have thirteen children there. Upon the death of both parents little more than a year apart in 1858, the property passed to two of their sons John and Patrick.<ref name=nswshr-4/>
The property was mortgaged to pay the debts of the estate and the house was let to J. Kidd, JP, who remained in tenancy until 1878 when the property was sold to the Fieldhouse brothers. The Fieldhouse brothers were prominent businessmen in Campbelltown who owned over 44 properties within the town by 1884. From 1878-1891 "Glenalvin Hall" was the residence of Edwin Fieldhouse and his family. From 1891-1904 the property remained in the joint ownership of the brothers at the end of which time they divided their assets with Edwin retaining Glenalvon.<ref name=nswshr-4-43>Lot 91</ref> Edwin vacated the house shortly after and it was variously tenanted until 1920 when it was sold to the Bursill Family.<ref name=nswshr-4/>
Glenalvon remained in the ownership of the Bursill family until 1965 when it was acquired by the (then) [[State Planning Authority]] (SPA) for $35,000.<ref name=nswshr-4-44>Lucas interview, 2011</ref><ref name=nswshr-4/>
In 1969 architect John Fisher (member of the Institute of Architects, the Cumberland County Council Historic Buildings Committee and on the first Council of the [[National Trust of Australia]] (NSW) after its reformation in 1960) was commissioned by the State Planning Authority to restore the first five houses in Campbelltown, which had been resumed under the Cumberland County Planning Scheme. They included Glenalvon.<ref name=nswshr-4/><ref name=nswshr-4-18>Lucas & McGinness, 2012</ref>
In 1970 the house and stables were restored by [[Clive Lucas]] at Fisher Jackson and Hudson and Lucas recalls this property as the conservation project where he first used the then innovative heritage principle of researching and understanding the fabric of a place before attempting conservation, including the use of paint scrapes to establish original paint schemes.<ref name=nswshr-4-44/> The house was tenanted by the Oakham family from 1970 to 2010 and the stables are used as a resource centre by the Campbelltown and [[Airds, New South Wales|Airds]] District Historical Society.<ref name=nswshr-4/>
The State Planning Authority sold Glenalvon to Campbelltown City Council and the Campbelltown & Airds District Historical Society now manage the building and garden, running displays, meetings, events.<ref name=nswshr-4-45>Nicholas, pers.comm., 8/10/2013</ref><ref name=nswshr-4/>
== Description == ;Garden: The house is set in a mature garden, which contains some historic plantings including tall columnar Cook's pine (''[[Araucaria columnaris]]''), silky oak (''[[Grevillea robusta]]'') and Californian desert fan palm (''[[Washingtonia robusta]]'').<ref name=nswshr-4/>
;House: A two-storey [[Australian residential architectural styles#Georgian|Georgian]] finely cut [[sandstone]] residence with symmetrical [[facade]]. The front [[Veranda|verandah]] is stone flagged and is supported by turned stone Doric style [[columns]]. The [[hipped roof]], originally shingled, is now clad in [[Corrugated galvanised iron|corrugated iron]]. The main entrance is located centrally on the southern elevation and double verandah posts on either side emphasise the point of entry. There are shuttered [[French doors]] either side of the main entry, opening onto the verandah. The five windows to the upper floor are double hung, timber sashed and of 9 panes to both the upper and lower [[Sash window|sashes]]. The rear of the house has a verandah supported by flat timber columns. To the rear (north) of the house is located the former stables consisting of a symmetrical rectangular sandstone building with central [[gable]] on the eastern facade containing the entry doors and loft doors above. The hipped and gabled roof is clad in corrugated iron sheeting and has decorative timber barge boards. The roof framings were noted in 1973 as being jointed, dowelled, pegged and numbered without the use of nails (NT Listing). The verandah and [[eaves]] have timber [[Soffit|soffits]]. Cellars are located below the house.<ref name=nswshr-4/>
;Interior: Original cedar joinery, inc. six panelled doors, splayed panelled jambs to the windows and [[chimney]] pieces to the first floor; [[marble]] ground floor chimney pieces with sandstone mantlepieces; original geometric stair.<ref name=nswshr-4/>
=== Condition ===
As at 1 February 1999, The building and grounds are in excellent condition, having undergone extensive conservation works in 1969. The property has been very well maintained since that time, although the garden is currently somewhat overgrown.<ref name=nswshr-4/>
Glenalvon has survived with much of its significant 1840s fabric intact and the original curtilage and setting of the property can still be interpreted. The property has high overall integrity.<ref name=nswshr-4/>
=== Modifications and dates === *1969 - conservation and restoration of the building and grounds.<ref name=nswshr-4/>
The site is currently being evaluated through the preparation of a detailed conservation management plan (CMP). A CMP has been finalised and endorsed by the Heritage Council on 24 July 2000.<ref name=nswshr-4/>
== Heritage listing == As at 27 November 1998, Glenalvon is historically, aesthetically and socially significant as one of the oldest urban townhouses in the township of Campbelltown. The house and stables of Glenalvon are a significant landmark element. Glenalvon has been used continuously as a residence for almost 160 years and although some changes have been made to the house, much of the original fabric, dating from 1840, has survived intact. The landscape setting of the house is also important as it represents part of the original curtilage of the property and makes a major contribution to the historic townscape of Campbelltown.<ref name=nswshr-4/>
Glenalvon House was listed on the [[New South Wales State Heritage Register]] on 2 April 1999 having satisfied the following criteria.<ref name=nswshr-4/>
'''The place is important in demonstrating the course, or pattern, of cultural or natural history in New South Wales.'''
Glenalvon is of historical significance as one of the oldest uurban townhouses surviving in the township of Campbelltown. It is of further historical significance for it association with early and prominent families of the Campbelltown district and for its links to a way of life which has long since disappeared.<ref name=nswshr-4/>
'''The place is important in demonstrating aesthetic characteristics and/or a high degree of creative or technical achievement in New South Wales.'''
Glenalvon is of high aesthetic significance as a particularly fine Colonial Georgian sandstone residence retaining much of its 1840s fabric intact. The stables buildings are also of high aesthetic significance as are the grounds which give an indication of the early curtilage of the property. The house combined with its grounds are important as reminders of the setting of early town houses with their generously landscaped grounds. Both the building and grounds make a considerable contribution to the historic townscape of Campbelltown.<ref name=nswshr-4/>
'''The place has a strong or special association with a particular community or cultural group in New South Wales for social, cultural or spiritual reasons.'''
Glenalvon is of high social significance for its association with several prominent Campbelltown families and for its demonstration of the early pattern of life in the original township.<ref name=nswshr-4/>
'''The place has potential to yield information that will contribute to an understanding of the cultural or natural history of New South Wales.'''
Glenalvon is of high technical/research significance for its demonstration of colonial building techniques and for its use of local building materials and craftsmen, particularly the stonemasons, some of whom were convicts.<ref name=nswshr-4/>
'''The place possesses uncommon, rare or endangered aspects of the cultural or natural history of New South Wales.'''
Glenalvon is a rare surviving example of an 1840s townhouse to survive with much of its 1840s fabric and grounds intact, indicating the stature of such houses at the time of their construction.<ref name=nswshr-4/>
'''The place is important in demonstrating the principal characteristics of a class of cultural or natural places/environments in New South Wales.'''
Glenalvon is an excellent example of an 1840s townhouse in the Colonial Georgian style.<ref name=nswshr-4/>
== See also == {{stack|{{portal|Sydney|Architecture}}}} * [[Australian residential architectural styles]]

== External links == * {{URL|http://www.cahs.com.au/glenalvon.html|Glenalvon}} at {{URL|cahs.com.au|Campbelltown and Airds Historical Society Inc.}} * {{URL|https://mgnsw.org.au/organisations/glenalvon-house/|Glenalvon House}} at {{URL|mgnsw.org.au|Museums and Galleries of New South Wales}}

revision.comment: /* Change to paid listings */
revision.text:
{{Infobox Software | name = Google Shopping | logo = | logo size = | released = {{start date and age|2002|12|12}} (as Froogle)<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.internetnews.com/ec-news/article.php/1556221/Google+Feels+a+Little+Froogle.htm|title=Google Feels a Little Froogle - InternetNews.|work=Internet News|date=2002-12-12|accessdate=2016-03-12}}</ref> | latest_release_version = | latest_release_date = | latest_preview_version = | latest_preview_date = | operating_system = Any (web-based application) | genre = Price comparison | license = | website = {{url|http://www.google.com/shopping}} }}
'''Google Shopping''',<ref name="Google Commerce: Building a better shopping experience">{{cite web|url=http://googlecommerce.blogspot.com/2012/05/building-better-shopping-experience.html|title=Google Commerce: Building a better shopping experience|date=31 May 2012|publisher=Google Commerce Blog|accessdate=9 July 2012}}</ref> formerly '''Google Product Search''', '''Google Products''' and '''Froogle''', is a [[Google]] service invented by [[Craig Nevill-Manning]] which allows users to search for products on online shopping websites and compare prices between different vendors.
Originally, the service listed prices submitted by merchants, and was monetized through [[AdWords]] advertising like other Google services. However, in May 2012, Google announced that the service (which was also immediately renamed Google Shopping) would shift in late-2012 to a paid model where merchants would have to pay the company in order to list their products on the service.<ref name="Google Commerce: Building a better shopping experience" /><ref name="wsj-p2p"/>
In June 2017, Google Shopping was fined a record €2.4 billion by the EU Commission for giving its own online shopping services top priority in search results.<ref name=rapid-1784>{{Cite web|url=http://europa.eu/rapid/press-release_IP-17-1784_en.htm|title=European Commission - PRESS RELEASES - Press release - Antitrust: Commission fines Google €2.42 billion for abusing dominance as search engine by giving illegal advantage to own comparison shopping service|website=europa.eu|language=en|access-date=2017-06-27}}</ref>
==History== Created by [[Craig Nevill-Manning]]<ref name="ViseMalseed2006">{{cite book|author1=David A. Vise|author2=Mark Malseed|title=The Google Story|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=4appEmPMdF8C&pg=PA137|year=2006|publisher=Delta Trade Paperbacks|isbn=978-0-553-38366-9|pages=137–}}</ref> and launched in December 2002, Froogle was different from most other [[price comparison service]]s in that it used Google's [[web crawler]] to index product data from the websites of vendors instead of using paid submissions. As with Google Search, Froogle was instead monetized using Google's [[AdWords]] keyword advertising platform.<ref name=cnet-frooglelaunch>{{cite web|title=Google searches out an e-tail niche|url=http://news.cnet.com/Google-searches-out-an-e-tail-niche/2100-1017_3-977042.html|publisher=CNET|accessdate=28 March 2013}}</ref><ref name=bw-froogle>{{cite web|title=Will Froogle Be a Google for Shoppers? |url=http://www.businessweek.com/stories/2003-01-13/will-froogle-be-a-google-for-shoppers |publisher=Businessweek |accessdate=28 March 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130608154527/http://www.businessweek.com/stories/2003-01-13/will-froogle-be-a-google-for-shoppers |archivedate=8 June 2013 |df= }}</ref>
With its re-branding as Google Product Search, the service was modified to emphasize integration with [[Google Search]]; listings from the service could now appear alongside web search results.<ref name=cnet-pun/>
Google prominently featured the service result in [[Google Search]] starting in January 2008 in Germany and the United Kingdom. It subsequently extended the practice to France in October 2010, Italy, the Netherlands, and Spain in May 2011, the Czech Republic in February 2013 and Austria, Belgium, Denmark, Norway, Poland and Sweden in November 2013.<ref name=rapid-1784/>
===Change to paid listings=== Alongside the announcement of an immediate re-brand to '''Google Shopping''' on May 31, 2012, Google also announced that in late 2012, it would change the service to use a "pay-to-play" model, where merchants would have to pay Google to list their products on the service, with results influenced by both relevance and the bid amounts they pay. Google justified the move by stating that it would allow the service to "deliver the best answers for people searching for products and help connect merchants with the right customers."<ref name="Google Commerce: Building a better shopping experience" /><ref name="Google Product Search To Become Google Shopping">{{cite web|url=http://searchengineland.com/google-product-search-to-become-google-shopping-use-pay-to-play-model-122959|title=Google Product Search To Become Google Shopping, Use Pay-To-Play Model|last=Sullivan|first=Danny|date=31 May 2012|publisher=Search Engine Land|accessdate=9 July 2012}}</ref>
The change proved controversial; some small businesses showed concern that they would not be able to compete with larger companies that can afford a larger advertising budget.<ref name="wsj-p2p">{{cite web|url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/SB10001424052702304821304577438614258563608|title=Google Makes Shopping Site Pay-to-Play|last=Efrati|first=Amir|date=1 June 2012|publisher=The Wall Street Journal|accessdate=9 July 2012}}</ref> [[Microsoft]]'s [[Bing (search engine)|Bing]] also attacked the move in an advertising campaign known as "[[Scroogled]]," which called Google out for using "deceptive advertising practices" and suggesting that users use its competing Bing Shopping service instead.<ref name=iw-scroogled>{{cite web|title=Microsoft Scroogled Site Challenges Google Shopping Honesty|url=http://www.informationweek.com/byte/personal-tech/consumer-services/microsoft-scroogled-site-challenges-goog/240142956|publisher=InformationWeek|accessdate=30 March 2013}}</ref>
Google also revealed plans to integrate [[Google Catalogs]] with Google Shopping, to give users "more ways to find ideas and inspiration as you shop and engage with your favorite brand."<ref>{{cite news|url=https://techcrunch.com/2012/10/01/google-catalogs-comes-to-the-web-now-integrated-with-google-shopping/|title=Google Catalogs Comes To The Web, Now Integrated With Google Shopping|publisher=TechCrunch|accessdate=October 1, 2012}}</ref>
In June 2017, Google Shopping was fined a record €2.4 billion by the EU Commission for giving its own online shopping services top priority in search results.<ref name=rapid-1784/>
==Naming== Google Shopping was originally known as '''Froogle''', a pun on the term "[[wikt:frugal|frugal]]." On April 18, 2007, the product was renamed '''Google Product Search'''; the name was dropped due to concerns surrounding internationalization, people not understanding the [[pun]] or understanding what the service was actually about, and concerns related to the company's [[trademark infringement]] lawsuit against competing website Froogles.<ref name=cnet-pun>{{cite web|title=Google takes the pun out of shopping|date=18 April 2007| url=http://news.cnet.com/2100-1038_3-6177393.html|publisher=CNET|accessdate=28 March 2013}}</ref> On May 31, 2012, the product was renamed to '''Google Shopping'''.<ref name="Google Commerce: Building a better shopping experience"/> The URL "froogle.com" remains as a redirect to Google Shopping's website.
== Antitrust fine == On June 27, 2017, the European Commissioner for Competition, [[Margrethe Vestager]], decided to fine Google €2.4 billion for breaching EU antitrust rules. Google was found to have abused its market dominance as a search engine by giving illegal advantages to another Google product, its own comparison shopping service.<ref name="europa">[http://europa.eu/rapid/press-release_STATEMENT-17-1806_en.htm Statement by Commissioner Vestager on Commission decision to fine Google €2.42 billion for abusing dominance as search engine by giving illegal advantage to own comparison shopping service], on ''europa.eu'', accessed on 7 July 2017.</ref>
According to the European Commission, Google started giving its own Froogle significantly better treatment than rivals as early as 2008. It first began in [[Germany]] and the [[United Kingdom]], followed by [[France]], [[Italy]], the [[Netherlands]], [[Spain]], then the [[Czech Republic]] and finally [[Austria]], [[Belgium]], [[Denmark]], [[Norway]], [[Poland]] and [[Sweden]]. A total 418 million citizens of the [[European Economic Area]] are claimed to have been deprived of the full benefits of competition, genuine choice and innovation.<ref name="europa"/> Further damage payments may have to be required from Google should it not comply with European antitrust rules within 90 days.<ref name="europa"/>
==Countries== Google Shopping is currently available in:<ref>[http://www.webpronews.com/google-shopping-rolls-out-in-more-countries-2013-02 Google Shopping Rolls Out In More Countries]. WebProNews. Retrieved on 2013-11-29.</ref><ref>[http://adwords.blogspot.com.es/2013/11/google-shopping-now-available-in-8-new.html Inside AdWords: Google Shopping ]</ref> * Australia * Austria * Bangladesh * Belgium * Brazil * Canada * Czech Republic * Denmark * France * Germany * India * Italy * Israel * Japan * Mexico * Netherlands * Norway * Poland * Russia * Spain * Sweden * Switzerland * Turkey * United Kingdom * United States {{Div col end}}
== See Also ==
* [[Comparison shopping website]]
== References == {{reflist}}
==External links== *[http://www.google.com/shopping Google Shopping] {{Google Inc.}}
[[Category:Google Search|Shopping]] [[Category:Google services|Shopping]] [[Category:Comparison shopping websites]] [[Category:Computer-related introductions in 2002]] [[Category:Internet properties established in 2002]]

'''Illinois Reports''' is the official [[Law report|reporter]] of the [[Illinois Supreme Court]].{{ref|705ILCS65/4}} It is published by [[Thomson Reuters]], under contract with the Illinois Supreme Court [[Reporter of Decisions]]. The Illinois Supreme Court retains the [[copyright]].
For purposes of [[Case citation|citation]], ''Illinois Reports'' and ''Illinois Reports Second'' are abbreviated "Ill." and "Ill. 2d"; although, the oldest volumes are abbreviated "Breeze"{{ref|Breeze}}, "Gilm."{{ref|Gilm}}, and "Scam."{{ref|Scam}}, for ''Breeze's Illinois Reports'', ''Gilman's Illinois Reports'', and ''Scammon's Illinois Reports''.
The publication is separate from ''Illinois Decisions''--a popular unofficial reporter also published by Thomson Reuters--that contains additional materials, such as the [[Westlaw#Key_Number_System|West Key Number System]].
==See also== * [[Illinois Appellate Reports]] * [[Law of Illinois]]
==References== #{{note|705ILCS65/4}} [http://www.ilga.gov/legislation/ilcs/documents/070500650K4.htm 705 ILCS 65/4] #{{note|Breeze}} [http://www.legalabbrevs.cardiff.ac.uk/displaydetails?portal=false&abbr=Breese&title=3973 Cardiff Index to Legal Abbreviations:Breeze's Illinois Reports] #{{note|Gilm}} [http://www.legalabbrevs.cardiff.ac.uk/displaydetails?portal=false&abbr=Gilm.&title=3971 Cardiff Index to Legal Abbreviations:Gilman's Illinois Reports] #{{note|Scam}} [http://www.legalabbrevs.cardiff.ac.uk/displaydetails?portal=false&abbr=Scam.&title=3972 Cardiff Index to Legal Abbreviations:Scammon's Illinois Reports]
==External links== * [https://books.google.com/books?q=editions:04Gs-BOErZ8J4-ZJZlrWj_&id=00cLAAAAYAAJ Illinois Reports] (Full Text of Various Editions) * [http://www.state.il.us/court/SupremeCourt/library/SCTReports_Index.pdf Chronological Index to Information Contained in the Illinois Supreme Court Reporters, Excluding Opinions] * [https://books.google.com/books?id=BPsvAAAAIAAJ&pg=PA22 The Lawyer's Reference Manual of Law Books and Citations: American Reports: Illinois] (1884) (Notes on Volumes and Editions) * [http://www.ilga.gov/LEGISLATION/ILCS/ilcs3.asp?ActID=1841&ChapAct=705%26nbsp%3BILCS%26nbsp%3B65%2F&ChapterID=50&ChapterName=COURTS&ActName=Official+Court+Reports+Act. Illinois Official Court Reports Act] (705 ILCS 65/) * [http://www.state.il.us/court/supremecourt/supportstaff.asp Illinois Supreme Court Support Staff & Contact Information] (Illinois Supreme Court Reporter of Decisions)
[[Category:Case law reporters]] [[Category:Illinois state courts]] {{US-law-stub}}

{{Infobox Magazine | title = Inside New York | frequency = 1 per year | circulation = 75,000 | page count = 386, full-color | language = [[American English]] | category = Guide Book | firstdate = September 1980 | country = [[United States]] | website = [http://www.insidenewyork.com www.insidenewyork.com] }} '''''Inside New York''''' is a [[New York City]] [[guidebook]] written and published annually by students of several universities, including [[Columbia University]], [[New York University]], [[The New School]] and other New York City universities. Founded in 1978 as the ''Columbia Guide to New York'' and given exclusively to incoming freshmen, it currently is distributed to several colleges, graduate programs, and businesses throughout New York City, in addition to being sold at [[independent bookstore]]s and major retailers. Inside New York will be launching the first electronic edition of the guide book in September 2013.
==References==
*{{Citation | last = Kilgannon | first = Corey | title = To Sell A Guidebook, A Dose Of Attitude | journal = The New York Times | date = March 7, 1999 | url = https://www.nytimes.com/1999/03/07/nyregion/new-yorkers-co-to-sell-a-guidebook-a-dose-of-attitude.html?scp=1&sq=columbia%20guide%20to%20new%20york%20dose%20of%20attitude&st=cse }} *{{Citation | last = Busis | first = Hillary | title = ‘Inside New York’ takes students outside the bubble | journal = Columbia Daily Spectator | date = September 22, 2009 | url = http://www.columbiaspectator.com/2009/09/22/inside-new-york-takes-students-outside-bubble }}
==External links== *[http://www.insidenewyork.com Inside New York Official Site]
[[Category:Travel guide books]] [[Category:Columbia University]] [[Category:Books about New York City]]
